item.title: Amazed by how ring theory can be linked up to topology
item.description: I am reviewing some fundamental algebra, and I just learnt something beautifully suggesting the connection of ring theory and geometry, which made me eager to learn some algebraic geometry (which I was not very interested when I was in undergrad). It is an exercise in Aluffi’s book1. Lets’ jump into it. The problem Let $K$ be a compact topological space, and let $R$ be the ring of continuous real-valued functions on $K$, with addition and multiplication defined pointwise.
